com.ibm.wcs.annotationservice.test.util

Class TestHarness

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.wcs.annotationservice.test.util.TestHarness
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AnnotationServiceTestHarness

    public class TestHarness
extends Object
    Superclass containing various helper methods for JUnit tests; supersedes the old "TestUtils" class.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  TestHarness.SubprocessCallback

    • Method Detail

      • init

        protected void init()
        Perform initializations here rather than in constructor so that subclasses can override, if need be

      • startTest

        protected void startTest()
        Call this method when starting a test, to initialize internal state. The name of the calling method is used as a prefix.

      • startTest

        protected void startTest(String prefix)
        Call this method when starting a test, to initialize internal state.
        Parameters:
        prefix - name of the test, used as a prefix for any input/output directories of the test.

      • forkTest

        protected boolean forkTest(String... jvmArgs)
                    throws Exception
        Call this method when starting a test to run the test in a subprocess. Starts up a subprocess that will execute the same test case. The return value of this function tells whether the test case is running in the child or whether the test case has completed and has returned control to the parent. Common usage of this method is to put the following: if (forkTest()) return; instead of startTest() at the beginning of the test case. NOTE: This method currently does not attempt to call setUp() or tearDown() methods, since those methods are global to the test harness. Any harness-wide initialization will need to be either inside the constructor or repeated in the test case.
        Parameters:
        jvmArgs - additional arguments to pass to the subprocess's Java interpreter
        Returns:
        true from the parent process, false from the child
        Throws:
        Exception

      • startHook

        protected void startHook()
        This method is called from startTest() after all other per-test initialization is complete. Subclasses can override this method to provide some initialization upcalls.

      • endTest

        protected void endTest()
        Call this method at the conclusion of a test to release any resources.

      • getCurPrefix

        Returns:

      • compareAgainstExpected

        public void compareAgainstExpected(boolean truncate)
                            throws Exception
        Compare output files for the current test against the corresponding "gold standard" files stored on disk.
        Parameters:
        truncate - true to truncate the files being compared to TRUNCATE_LEN_KCHAR kb
        Throws:
        Exception

      • truncateExpectedFiles

        public void truncateExpectedFiles()
                           throws Exception
        Helper method to emulate the old behavior of only truncating expected files by characters only.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • truncateExpectedFiles

        public void truncateExpectedFiles(boolean truncByLines)
                           throws Exception
        Truncate all the "gold standard" files stored on disk to TRUNCATE_LEN_KCHAR kb or to .EXPECTED_RESULTS_FILE_NUM_LINES lines if HTML.

        NOTE: This method only truncates the files in the top-level directory and does NOT recurse to subdirs.

        Throws:
        Exception

      • truncateOutputFiles

        public void truncateOutputFiles(boolean truncByLines)
                         throws Exception
        Truncate all the output files stored on disk to TRUNCATE_LEN_KCHAR kb.
        Parameters:
        trunByLines - ignored but kept around to avoid breaking code in other projects.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • compareAgainstExpected

        public void compareAgainstExpected(String filename,
                                   boolean truncate)
                            throws IOException,
                                   Exception
        Compare an output file from a regression test against the expected output stored in CVS.
        Parameters:
        filename - name of the output file, not containing the directory it's in; file is assumed to be in curOutputDir.
        truncate - true to truncate the files being compared
        Throws:
        IOException
        Exception

      • compareAgainstExpected

        public void compareAgainstExpected(String filename,
                                   int linesToSkip,
                                   int linesToCompare)
                            throws IOException,
                                   Exception
        Compare an output file from a regression test against the expected output, skipping some lines from the beginning and/or end. Mainly intended to compare module metadata.xml files, whose header changes every time.
        Parameters:
        filename - name of the output file, not containing the directory it's in; file is assumed to be in curOutputDir.
        linesToSkip - how many lines to ignore (from both input files) before beginning the comparison; for use when the files are expected to differ slightly in the header
        linesToCompare - how many lines of the file to compare with each other, or -1 to look at both files to the end
        Throws:
        IOException
        Exception

      • truncateExpectedFile

        public void truncateExpectedFile(String filename)
                          throws IOException
        Truncate all the "gold standard" files stored on disk to TRUNCATE_LEN_KCHAR kb
        Parameters:
        filename - name of the expected file, not containing the directory it's in; file is assumed to be in #expectedDir
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getBaseDir

        protected File getBaseDir()
        Subclasses may override this method as needed to relocate the regression test output directory tree.
        Returns:
        base directory for regression test outputs

      • getJavaExecPath

        public static String getJavaExecPath()
                              throws Exception
        Returns:
        the name of the java executable being used by the current process; useful for spawning new subprocesses
        Throws:
        Exception
